metadata.dc:author: Soler Roselló, A
Conejero Sugrañés, J
Prera Vilaseca, A
Ahmad Wahab, A
Vila Barja, J
Banus Gassol, J M
metadata.dc:description: Trigono-cervico-prostatotomy (TCP) incision was performed endoscopically in 102 patients, 99 for benign hypertrophy of the prostate (BHP) less than 35 g., and 3 for bladder neck obstruction. Good results were achieved in 81.4%, symptom relief was achieved in 12.7%, and 5.8% required reoperation. The incidence of retrograde ejaculation was only 20.6%. Patient follow-up was one year. Our findings show the usefulness of ultrasound, urethroscopy and urodynamics in determining the size of the adenoma and in assessing the results achieved by the surgical technique.
metadata.dc:title: Trigonocervicoprostatotomía (TCP). Técnica, resultados clínicos y urodinámicos.
[Trigono-cervico-prostatomy. Technic, clinical and urodynamic results].
